title: Coca-Cola chief: ‘Have taxes solved the problem of obesity? No’
text:
Few companies shout “USA” as loudly on the global stage as Coca-Cola. The all-conquering beverage maker, worth more than $230bn (£179bn), is as American as eating a McDonald’s burger on a Harley-Davidson.

For the first time in its 127 years, however, Coca-Cola is run by a Brit. James Quincey took the top job in 2017, adding the chairman title earlier this year. His improbable journey from a degree in electronic engineering at Liverpool University to end up leading an American icon recognised everywhere on Earth has been “long and circuitous”, he admits, after addressing the One Young World summit in London.
